summary: Foreign countries, primarily China, attempt to improperly influence scientists conducting federally funded research, creating risks of fraud and to research integrity. Agencies address this risk through research security processes, but there are concerns that these efforts unfairly target scientists of Chinese or Asian descent. We identified five safeguards to help agencies avoid discrimination, but agencies varied in their use. Further, no agency had assessed the...
title: Research Security: Agencies Should Assess Safeguards Against Discrimination
